00022 void pcan_receive::hlpMsg()
00023 {
00030         printf("pcan_receive - a small node, based on receivetest , which receives CAN messages and publishes them on a topic.\n");
00031         printf("usage:   pcan_receive { | [-b=BTR0BTR1]  [-?]\n");
00032         printf("         -b - BTR0BTR1 code in hex, e.g.\n");
00033         printf("                0x0014  =   1 MBit/s\n");
00034         printf("                0x001C  = 500 kBit/s\n");
00035         printf("                0x011C  = 250 kBit/s\n");
00036         printf("                0x031C  = 125 kBit/s\n");
00037         printf("                0x432F  = 100 kBit/s\n");
00038         printf("                0x472F  =  50 kBit/s\n");
00039         printf("                0x532F  =  20 kBit/s\n");
00040         printf("                0x672F  =  10 kBit/s\n");
00041         printf("                0x7F7F  =   5 kBit/s\n");
00042         printf("                (default: 1 Mbit).\n");
00043         printf("                -? or --help - this help\n");
00044         printf("\n");
00045 
00046 }

00049 pcan_receive::pcan_receive()

00058   nType = HW_PCI;

00074   bDevNodeGiven = false;
00075   bTypeGiven    = false;
00076   errno = 0;
00077   pcan_pub = n.advertise<std_msgs::String>("pcan_received", 1);

00081 void pcan_receive::init(int argc, char **argv)
00082 {
00091         // decode command line arguments
00092                 for (i = 1; i < argc; i++)
00093                 {
00094                     char c;
00095 
00096                     ptr = argv[i];
00097 
00098                     while (*ptr == '-')
00099                       ptr++;
00100 
00101                     c = *ptr;
00102                     ptr++;
00103 
00104                     if (*ptr == '=')
00105                       ptr++;
00106 
00107                     switch(tolower(c))
00108                     {
00109                       case '?':
00110                       case 'h':
00111                         hlpMsg();
00112                         do_exit(errno);
00113                         break;
00114                       case 'b':
00115                         wBTR0BTR1 = (__u16)strtoul(ptr, NULL, 16);
00116                         break;
00117                       default:
00118                          errno = EINVAL;
00119                          do_exit(errno);;
00120                         break;
00121                     }
00122                 }
00123                   /* open CAN port */
00124                    if ((bDevNodeGiven) || (!bDevNodeGiven && !bTypeGiven))
00125                    {
00126                      h = LINUX_CAN_Open(szDevNode, O_RDWR);
00127                      if (!h)
00128                      {
00129                        printf("pcan_receive: can't open %s\n", szDevNode);
00130                        do_exit(errno);;
00131                      }
00132                    }
00133                    else {
00134                      // please use what is appropriate
00135                      // HW_DONGLE_SJA
00136                      // HW_DONGLE_SJA_EPP
00137                      // HW_ISA_SJA
00138                      // HW_PCI
00139                      h = CAN_Open(nType, dwPort, wIrq);
00140                      if (!h)
00141                      {
00142                        printf("pcan_receive: can't open %s device.\n", getNameOfInterface(nType));
00143                        do_exit(errno);;
00144                      }
00145                    }
00146                    /* clear status */
00147                      CAN_Status(h);
00148                      // get version info
00149                      errno = CAN_VersionInfo(h, txt);
00150                      if (!errno)
00151                        printf("pcan_receive: driver version = %s\n", txt);
00152                      else {
00153                        perror("pcan_receive: CAN_VersionInfo()");
00154                        do_exit(errno);;
00155                      }
00156                      // init to a user defined bit rate
00157                      if (wBTR0BTR1)
00158                      {
00159                        errno = CAN_Init(h, wBTR0BTR1, 0x00);
00160                        if (errno)
00161                        {
00162                          perror("pcan_receive: CAN_Init()");
00163                          do_exit(errno);;
00164                        }
00165                      }
00166 
00167 }
00168 void pcan_receive::receive()
00169 {
00177                 // Real code
00178                 TPCANRdMsg m;
00179                 __u32 status;
00180                 if (LINUX_CAN_Read(h, &m))
00181                 {
00182                         perror("pcan_receive: LINUX_CAN_Read()");
00183                 }
00184                 else
00185                 {
00186                         //print_message_ex(&m);
00187                         // check if a CAN status is pending
00188                         if (m.Msg.MSGTYPE & MSGTYPE_STATUS)
00189                         {
00190                                 status = CAN_Status(h);
00191                                 if ((int)status < 0)
00192                                 {
00193                                         errno = nGetLastError();
00194                                         perror("pcan_receive: CAN_Status()");
00195                                 }
00196                                 else
00197                                         printf("pcan_receive: pending CAN status 0x%04x read.\n", (__u16)status);
00198                         }
00199                 }
00200                 pcan_pub.publish(TPCANRdMsgToString(m));
00201 
00202 
00203 }

00209 std_msgs::String pcan_receive::TPCANRdMsgToString(TPCANRdMsg m)
00210 {
00218         std_msgs::String msg;
00219         std::stringstream ss;
00220         ss << m.dwTime << ".";
00221         if(m.wUsec>=100)
00222         {
00223                 ss << m.wUsec << " ";
00224         }
00225         else
00226         {
00227                 if(m.wUsec>=10)
00228                 {
00229                         ss << "0" <<m.wUsec << " ";
00230                 }
00231                 else
00232                 {
00233                         ss << "00" <<m.wUsec << " ";
00234                 }
00235         }
00236         char IDENT[4];
00237         sprintf(IDENT, "%02X", m.Msg.ID);
00238         ss << "0x" << IDENT << " ";
00239         //ss << " " << m.Msg.ID << " ";
00240         char LEN[3];
00241         sprintf(LEN, "%02X", m.Msg.LEN);
00242         ss << "0x" << LEN << " ";
00243         for (int i=0; i<sizeof(m.Msg.DATA); i++)
00244         {
00245                 char DATA[3];
00246                 sprintf(DATA, "%02X", m.Msg.DATA[i]);
00247                 ss <<"0x" << DATA << " ";
00248         }
00249         msg.data=ss.str();
00250         return msg;
00251 }
